intro: Clidemia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Clidemia portoricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
